results.title: Marathon I
results.creator_credit: Tim Kupsch and John Blackett-Smith Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the individual training strategies and motivation of top world marathon runner Robert de Castella of Australia and Alberto Salazar of the USA. Follows each of them as they fight it out in the 1982 Rotterdam marathon, highlighting the incredible winning performance by de Castella, who after having run twenty-five miles at a rate of five minutes per mile, covered the last mile in a staggering four minutes and thirty-two seconds.

results.title: The Singer and the Dancer
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong and Australian Film Council
results.brief_description: Set in the country, an older woman relives the bitter memories of her past, through her friendship with a younger girl who is experiencing a very insecure relationship with her boyfriend. Winner of several awards including Australian Film Awards and Sydney Film Festival. Cast includes Ruth Cracknell, Elizabeth Crosby, Russell Keifel, Jude Kuring, Gerry Duggan, Julie Dawson, Jane Buckland, Kate Sheil, Rob Steele, Kerry Walker. Photographer: Russell Boyd. Based on a short story by Alan Marshall.

results.title: This woman is not a car
results.creator_credit: Margaret Dodd, Jenny Jacobs, Vyner Gillespie and Arid Zone Productions
results.brief_description: A mother, isolated in an outer Adelaide suburb, drives a station wagon full of children to a distant beach. Imagination and reality fuse. Her sense of herself is assaulted by car fetishists in a rural service station. Memory, fear and fantasy are interwoven as this experimental film takes woman’s assigned role in the ‘Australian Dream’ to its absurd conclusion. Music: Brian Eno, The Fabulous Nudes, The Pelaco Bros. Actors include Pauline Sedgwick, Daniel Sedgwick, Lisa Sedgwick, Gareth Sedgwick and Katrina Sedgwick.

results.title: More tricks than we have (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An introduction to how theatre in education works. Begins with a group of actors from Toe Truck Theatre and their director in the early stages of devising a play. We see the performance and follow up discussions and workshops. Based on the play “Year 9 are animals”, which tells the story of an enthusiastic first year teacher and the problems he encounters.

results.title: Communication at work
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Trigger series 7. Managing people”.
Dramatisations of seven brief interactions between staff members. Designed to trigger discussion on communication at work.

results.title: Decisions in academic departments
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Trigger series 7. Managing people”.
Six dramatisations dealing with interpersonal aspects of staff management are designed to trigger discussion. Although set in a university the issues raised are common to all organisations.

results.title: Because They're Black
results.creator_credit: Rosemary Burden, Roy Wooding, Education Dept, S A and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A series of revealing interviews with Aboriginal students show what pressures exist for them in a white racist society. Teachers, parents and teacher’s aides are also interviewed. A good discussion starter for all those involved in the education of Aboriginal students.

results.title: The Janet Gardiner Case: Forensic Science at Work
results.brief_description: A dramatised film explaining, through the re-creation of a crime, the concept of forensic science and showing how the Forensic Section of the Police Department operates.
